sentences.en: ...an eclipse of the sun.
sentences.cn: …一次日食。

sentences.en: ...the solar eclipse on May 21.
sentences.cn: …5月21日的日食。

sentences.en: a total eclipse
sentences.cn: 全食

sentences.en: A total solar eclipse is due to take place some time tomorrow.
sentences.cn: 明天某个时刻会发生日全食。

sentences.en: An eclipse is an unusual occurrence.
sentences.cn: 蚀是不常见的事情.

sentences.en: an eclipse of the sun
sentences.cn: 日食

sentences.en: Einstein's Law of Gravitation was tested during an eclipse of the sun.
sentences.cn: 爱因斯坦的引力定律在一次日蚀期间得到了检验.

sentences.en: Her eyes were in eclipse.
sentences.cn: 她的眼睛黯淡无光.

sentences.en: his political power was in eclipse.
sentences.cn: 他失去了政治势力。

sentences.en: Its beautiful rays are a sensational sight during an eclipse.
sentences.cn: 它那美丽的光线在日食时景象非常壮观.

sentences.en: Mo did not want to be ruled by anyone and it is notable that she never allowed the men in her life to eclipse her.
sentences.cn: 莫不想受任何人支配，而且很明显她从不容许自己生活里的男性光芒盖过自己。

sentences.en: Once a famous actress, she is now in eclipse.
sentences.cn: 过去她是名演员, 今日已黯然失色.

sentences.en: The Deputy Fuehrer found himself in eclipse.
sentences.cn: 这位副元首觉得自己已黯然失色.

sentences.en: The economy had eclipsed the environment as an election issue.
sentences.cn: 经济作为竞选话题已经盖过环境问题。

sentences.en: The various items of eclipse equipment are chosen according to the circumstance.
sentences.cn: 各式各样的日食观测设备应根据环境取舍.

sentences.en: The writer's name remained in eclipse for many years after his death.
sentences.cn: 这位作者死后很多年,名字一直湮没无闻.

sentences.en: There will be a total eclipse of the sun next Monday.
sentences.cn: 下礼拜一将有全日蚀.

sentences.en: There will be an eclipse of the moon next month.
sentences.cn: 下个月有月食.

sentences.en: This is losing soler eclipse.
sentences.cn: 这是日蚀.

sentences.en: This keeps us informed about the progress of the eclipse.
sentences.cn: 这使我们对日食的过程有所了解.

sentences.en: Yes, certainly, everybody was still wondering at Nana's total eclipse.
sentences.cn: 可不是吗, 自然任何人都还在奇怪娜娜何以会完全销声匿迹呢.

trans.tran_cn: 日食，月食，丧失，黯然失色
trans.tran_en: an occasion when the sun or the moon cannot be seen, because the Earth is passing directly between the moon and the sun, or because the moon is passing directly between the Earth and the sun
to become more important, powerful, famous etc than someone or something else, so that they are no longer noticed

trans.tran_cn: 食， 遮掩光； 使暗淡， 使失色， 使相形见绌
trans.tran_en: to become more important, powerful, famous etc than someone or something else, so that they are no longer noticed
